member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider
member.summary: Represents the AzMan authorization provider. Authorize method checks to see if the specified identity has access to a task.
member.remarks: Supports Windows authentication only. Requires AzMan on Windows Server 2003, or Windows XP users will need to install the Windows Server 2003 Administration Pack. Implements the interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.Instrumentation.IAuthorizationProviderInstrumentationProvider)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.Authorize(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal,System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates the specified authority against the specified context that is either a task or operation in Authorization Manager. If the context is an operation it should be prefixed by "O".
member.param: Principal object containing a Windows identity.
Name of the task or operation to evaluate.
member.returns: True if AzMan evaluates to true, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.CheckAccessTasks(System.String,System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity,System.String[])
member.devdoc: Checks access to specified a set of tasks in a specified application in a specified scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.CheckAccessOperations(System.String,System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity,System.String[])
member.devdoc: Checks access to specified a set of operations in a specified application in a specified scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.AzManAuthorizationProvider.GetClientContext(System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity,System.String,Microsoft.Interop.Security.AzRoles.IAzApplication@)
member.devdoc: Gets the client context for the call based on the identity, system and parameters.

member.summary: Location of the authorization store, Active Directory or xml file.
member.remarks: Absolute file paths are required for xml storage. View this link for more information about the expected format http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/security/security/azauthorizationstore_initialize.asp.

member.remarks: The audit identifier is generated to be "prefix username:operation"

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.DesignResources.AzManAuthorizationProviderDataDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Windows Authorization Manager (AzMan) is an authorization provider that can authorize against Active Directory, an XML file, or a database; or by using custom rules that you define and are stored as XML in the application configuration file. .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.DesignResources.AzManAuthorizationProviderDataScopeDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An optional name for the AzMan application scope. Scopes permit the use of different authorization settings for different parts of an application. .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.DesignResources.AzManAuthorizationProviderDataScopeDisplayName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Application Scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Security.AzMan.Configuration.DesignResources.AzManAuthorizationProviderDataStoreLocationDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The location of the authorization store configured in Windows Authorization Manager (AzMan). This can be an XML file, a database, or a part of Active Directory. The default location for an XML file is msxml://c:/myAuthStore.xml. The default for Active Directory is msldap://myserver/CN=MyStore,OU=AzMan,DC=MyDomain,DC=Com..
